docTitle.titlePart:
THE BIFURCATION
INTERPRETER:
A STEP TOWARDS
THE AUTOMATIC
ANALYSIS OF DYNAMICAL
SYSTEMS

byline.affiliation: Artificial Intelligence Laboratory, Massachusetts Institute of Technology,

front.div:
Al~tract--The Bifurcation Interpreter is a computer program that autonomously explores the steady-state
orbits of one-parameter families of periodically-driven oscillators. To report its findings, the Interpreter
generates schematic diagrams and English text descriptions similar to those appearing in the science and
engineering research literature. Given a system of equations as input, the Interpreter uses symbolic algebra
to automatically generate numerical procedures that simulate the system. The Interpreter incorporates
knowledge about dynamical systems theory, which it uses to guide the simulations, to interpret the results
and to minimize the effects of numerical error.
